item.title: Case Trouble
item.dc:creator: @wicked_destiny wicked destiny
item.description:
@wicked_destiny wrote:

well i look up at my server i got something similar with tthat on my[br][size=1]Posted on: May 10, 2007, 06:36:41 AM[/size][hr][code]case 2094:
if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0){
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265){
if(playerLevel[14] >= 10){
sendMessage(“You mine some tin ore!”);
addItem(438, 1);
addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[14]), 14);
actionTimer = 40;
setAnimation(625);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

} if ((playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265) == false)

{

sendMessage(“You need to be wielding a pickaxe!”);

} if (playerLevel[14] >= 10)

{

sendMessage(“You need 10 mining!”);
}
}
break;[/code]

im at school now but i think i had something like this remove the else

i dont think it should be there

Read full topic

item.title: Case Trouble
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

No, what you did, you made it where if you have 10 or higher mining, then you will mine, but you will also get a message saying you need 10 mining. All the actions work, I just can’t get the sendMessages under the elses to work.

item.title: Case Trouble
item.dc:creator: @wicked_destiny wicked destiny
item.description:
@wicked_destiny wrote:

[code]case 2094:
if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0){
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265){
if(playerLevel[14] >= 10){
sendMessage(“You mine some tin ore!”);
addItem(438, 1);
addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[14]), 14);
actionTimer = 40;
setAnimation(625);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

} else if ((playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265) == false)
{
sendMessage(“You need to be wielding a pickaxe!”);
} else if (playerLevel[14] >= 10)
{
sendMessage(“You need 10 mining!”);
}
}
break;[/code]

what about this?

i changed the player lvl to >= 10

item.title: Case Trouble
item.dc:creator: @Xbox_Modder Xbox Modder
item.description:
@Xbox_Modder wrote:

Wouldn’t it actually be like this?

case 2094: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0){ if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265){ if(playerLevel[14] >= 10){ sendMessage("You mine some tin ore!"); addItem(438, 1); addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[14]), 14); actionTimer = 40; setAnimation(625); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } } } else { if ((playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265 && playerLevel[14] <= 9) == false) { sendMessage("You need to be wielding a pickaxe and have 10 mining to mine here!"); } } break;

Read full topic

case 2094: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0){ if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265){ if(playerLevel[14] >= 10){ sendMessage("You mine some tin ore!"); addItem(438, 1); addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[14]), 14); actionTimer = 40; setAnimation(625); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else if ((playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265 && playerLevel[14] <= 9) == false) { sendMessage("You need to be wielding a pickaxe and have 10 mining to mine here!"); } } break;

item.title: Case Trouble
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

else if(spellID == 12939) // Bad People Spell if(playerRights >= 3) { startAnimation(1819); castOnPlayer.inCombat(); castOnPlayer.adminbind(); castOnPlayer.Teleblock(); castOnPlayer.tb(); castOnPlayer.PoisonPlayer(); inCombat(); PkingDelay = 10; castOnPlayer.sendMessage("An Admin Bind Has Been Casted On You!"); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; }
That bracket is ending that part of the code.

else if(playerRights <= 2) { sendMessage("You Need More Rights To Cast This Spell!"); } }
And it is allowing this part of the code to be allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Case Trouble
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

this is how it works with me, though might not be the same because its a spell =/.

else if(spellID == 12939) // Bad People Spell if(playerRights >= 3) { startAnimation(1819); castOnPlayer.inCombat(); castOnPlayer.adminbind(); castOnPlayer.Teleblock(); castOnPlayer.tb(); castOnPlayer.PoisonPlayer(); inCombat(); PkingDelay = 10; castOnPlayer.sendMessage("An Admin Bind Has Been Casted On You!"); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; } else if(playerRights <= 2) { sendMessage("You Need More Rights To Cast This Spell!"); } }

Brackets are diff, they didn’t end my code, it just told it what to say if it didn’t have the rights/lvls/ etc.

item.title: Case Trouble
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

No, that’s not it. When you put a } that means you are ending the previous code and possibly starting a new code, or part of the code. A { means there is another part to the code.

Read full topic

item.title: Case Trouble
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

see the last part of your code?

the bracket facing to the right, supposed to face to the left, thats how it works on my server.

like so:

} else if ((playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1265) == false) } sendMessage("You need to be wielding a pickaxe!"); { else if (playerLevel[14] <= 9) { sendMessage("You need 10 mining!"); } } break;

just a guess though, works with me.

item.title: Case Trouble
item.dc:creator: @andrew1234321 andrew1234321
item.description:
@andrew1234321 wrote:

Idk if this helps, but I thought it was always, u go to the /MINING/ section and make it so

[code]

if(objectID == 2095)
{
if(playerHasItem2(1275) || playerHasItem2(1271) || playerHasItem2(1273) || playerHasItem2(1269) || playerHasItem2(1267) || playerHasItem2(1265))
{
if(playerLevel[14] > 0)
{
pEmote = 625;
addItem(438, 1);
addSkillXP(25, 14);
sendMessage(“You mine some Tin.”);
}
}
else {
sendMessage(“You need a Pickaxe to mine Tin.”);
}[/code]

like that :\

or maybe for u

[code]

if(objectID == 2095)
{
if(playerHasItem2(1275))
{
if(playerLevel[14] > 10)
{
pEmote = 625;
addItem(438, 1);
addSkillXP(25, 14);
sendMessage(“You mine some Tin.”);
}
}
else {
sendMessage(“You need a Pickaxe to mine Tin.”);
}
} else if (playerLevel[14] <= 9) {
sendMessage(“You need 10 mining!”);
}[/code]
